com.samskivert.jdbc
Class JDBCUtil

java.lang.Object
  com.samskivert.jdbc.JDBCUtil

public class JDBCUtil
extends Object

A repository for JDBC related utility functions.

makeCollector

public static Connection makeCollector(Connection conn,
                                       List<Statement> stmts)
Wraps the given connection in a proxied instance that will add all statements returned by methods called on the proxy (such as Connection.createStatement()) to the supplied list. Thus you can create the proxy, pass the proxy to code that creates and uses statements and then close any statements created by the code that operated on that Connection before returning it to a pool, for example.

warnedUpdate

public static void warnedUpdate(PreparedStatement stmt,
                                int expectedCount)
                         throws SQLException

Throws:

batchQuery

public static void batchQuery(Connection conn,
                              String query,
                              Collection<?> keys,
                              boolean escapeKeys,
                              int batchSize,
                              JDBCUtil.BatchProcessor processor)
                       throws SQLException
Issues a query with a potentially large number of keys in batches. For example, you might have 10,000 ids that you wish to use in an "in" clause, but don't trust the database to be smart about optimizing that many keys, so instead you use batchQuery like so: 
    Collection keys = ...;
    String query = "select NAME from USERS where USER_ID in (#KEYS)";
    JDBCUtil.BatchProcessor proc = new JDBCUtil.BatchProcessor() {
        public void process (ResultSet row) {
            String name = rs.getString(1);
            // do whatever with name
        }
    };
    JDBCUtil.batchQuery(conn, query, keys, false, 500, proc);

Parameters:
query - the SQL query to run for each batch with the string #KEYS# in the place where the batch of keys should be substituted.
escapeKeys - if true, escape(java.lang.String) will be called on each key to escape any dangerous characters and wrap the key in quotes.
batchSize - the number of keys at a time to substitute in for #KEYS#.
Throws:
SQLException

warnedUpdate

public static void warnedUpdate(Statement stmt,
                                String query,
                                int expectedCount)
                         throws SQLException
Calls stmt.executeUpdate() on the supplied statement with the supplied query, checking to see that it returns the expected update count and logging a warning if it does not.

Throws:
SQLException

quote

public String quote(Date date)
Converts the date to a string and surrounds it in single-quotes via the escape method. If the date is null, returns null.

escape

public static String escape(String text)
Escapes any single quotes in the supplied text and wraps it in single quotes to make it safe for embedding into a database query.

escape

public static String escape(Object[] values)
Escapes a list of values, separating the escaped values by commas. See escape(String).

jigger

public static String jigger(String text)
Many databases simply fail to handle Unicode text properly and this routine provides a common workaround which is to represent a UTF-8 string as an ISO-8859-1 string. If you don't need to use the database's collation routines, this allows you to do pretty much exactly what you want at the expense of having to jigger and dejigger every goddamned string that might contain multibyte characters every time you access the database. Three cheers for progress!

unjigger

public static String unjigger(String text)
Reverses jigger(java.lang.String).

safeJigger

public static String safeJigger(String text)
Utility method to jigger the specified string so that it's safe to use in a regular Statement.

                                           String table,
                                           String[] definition,
                                           String postamble)
                                    throws SQLException
Used to programatically create a database table. Does nothing if the table already exists.

Returns:
true if the table was created, false if it already existed.

                           throws SQLException

tableContainsColumn

                                          String table,
                                          String column)
                                   throws SQLException
Returns true if the table with the specified name exists and contains a column with the specified name, false if either condition does not hold true. Note: the names are case sensitive.

Throws:
SQLException

tableContainsIndex

public static boolean tableContainsIndex(Connection conn,
                                         String table,
                                         String column,
                                         String index)
                                  throws SQLException
Returns true if the index on the specified column exists for the specified table, false if it does not. Optionally you can specifiy a non null index name, and the table will be checked to see if it contains that specifically named index. Note: the names are case sensitive.

Throws:
SQLException

public static int getColumnSize(Connection conn,
                                String table,
                                String column)
                         throws SQLException
Returns the size for the specified column in the specified table. For char or date types this is the maximum number of characters, for numeric or decimal types this is the precision.

SQLException

Adds a column (with name 'cname' and definition 'cdef') to the specified table.

Parameters:

changeColumn

public static void changeColumn(Connection conn,
                                String table,
                                String cname,
                                String cdef)
                         throws SQLException
Changes a column's definition. Takes a full column definition 'cdef' (including the name of the column) with which to replace the specified column 'cname'. NOTE: A handy thing you can do with this is to rename a column by providing a column definition that has a different name, but the same column type.

Throws:
SQLException

                                 String cname)

Returns:
true if the column was dropped, false if it did not exist in the first place.

SQLException

addIndexToTable

public static boolean addIndexToTable(Connection conn,
                                      String table,
                                      String cname,
                                      String iname)
                               throws SQLException
Adds an index on the specified column (cname) to the specified table. Optionally supply an index name, otherwise the index is named after the column.

Returns:
true if the index was added, false if it already existed.
Throws:
SQLException
